intro: Lampranthus leptaleon, commonly known as the slender-stemmed ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, and its small, star-shaped flowers are typically yellow or orange. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Lampranthus leptaleon is also valued for its resilience and ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
